text: Golden Syrup Hot Chocolate Sauce Chop the chocolate roughly.  Place the chocolate, cream, golden syrup and butter into a medium pan.  Stir over a low heat until the chocolate melts and the mixture is smooth.  Serve on top of ice cream straight away.  Finished.  Honey Hot Chocolate Sauce Pour the milk and cream into a small, heavy-based saucepan. Add the honey. Warm over a low heat. Stir constantly to combine. Melt the chocolate in a double boiler.  Pour the melted chocolate into the cream and milk mixture.  Mix well. Stir enough to combine. Serve immediately.  Spicy Hot Chocolate Sauce Chop the chocolate roughly.  Pour the wine into a small, heavy-based saucepan. Add the cinnamon stick, star anise and sugar. Bring to the boil. Reduce and simmer. When it has reduced a little, remove the cinnamon stick and star anise. Pour the cream into the mixture. Slowly return to the boil and add in the chopped chocolate. Stir constantly. Remove the sauce when it turns smooth and all of the chocolate pieces have melted.  Serve immediately. If you need to keep it warm, keep covered. Churros Hot Chocolate Sauce Chop the chocolate roughly.  Pour the cream into a heavy based small saucepan. Add the chopped chocolate. Heat gently. Stir constantly to combine. Remove from the heat when smooth and combined.  Serve immediately. Dip your churros in or spread over the biscuits.
